column4: hello im looking for software to delvier mathmatical papers, especially logic
i need to be able to write text and logical symbols easily, and print to pdf
is there anything like that out there for ubuntu?
you could try Open Office Formula.
is that a feature in openoffice writer?
i think not. try finding it in Software Centre.
it says its installed, so i guess it came with ubuntu default, going to see if i find it in any of the menus of writer :p
for me i can just go to it by Applications > Office > Open Office Formula. :)
did it come default?
i don't think so. i think you have to install Open Office.org suite or something. i forgot. :)
i found something called MainMenu under system preferences, it was set to be hidden by default, thanks for the help :)
oh, that. i didn't think of it. hope you enjoy. :)
how do i put the formulas made in OO math into writer ?
i do not know that. I, myself haven't gone beyond more than OO Document. :)
isnt writer the document thing? sorry, im abit confused, i need to put the formulas i make in math into a document
try this http://user.services.openoffice.org/en/forum/viewtopic.php?f=12&t=2919
i think that's what you are looking for. i think writer = document thingy. :)
nice thats exactly what i was looking for, dont even need to go into math, it pops up a little formula shell at the bottom :)
okie. i'm glad that helped you. :)
but i guess i should tech myself latex at some point :p
that's what i was thinking 2 days ago. :)
